    About me

    Yong Gao

    Neutron stars, pulsars, gravitational waves.

    • Potsdam, Germany
    • Email
    • ORCiD
    • Inspire
    • Google Scholar
    • Github

    Welcome to my website! I am currently a postdoctoral researcher in the Computational Relativistic Astrophysics group led by Masaru Shibata at the Albert Einstein Institute in Potsdam.

    Before this postdoc, I was a PhD student in the Gravitational Astrophysics group led by Lijing Shao at Peking University. I was also a member of the pulsar group at Peking University.

    My research interests focus on compact stars and strong-field gravity, with a current emphasis on neutron stars and tests of strong-field gravity. Please visit my research page for more detailed information about my research interests. Additionally, you can check out my publication page for a list of my relevant publications and works in progress.
